I would like each of the msg ("") to be an image from an html link using the instructions here:

Posts.EditableText:
It's a bug in the web editor.

You will get an error on exiting code view if your code contains a string which contains the character `<` (possibly also `>`, but that seems to be okay sometimes).

4 options to work around this (use whichever you understand):
1. Miss out the `<` and `>` when you edit in code view, and then add them in the GUI editor
2. Use numeric values (so your code looks like `msg (Chr(60) + "img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/vmFz0gn.jpg\" /" + Chr(62))`)
3. Make a text processor command to turn `{lt}` and `{gt}` into the `<` and `>` characters
4. override the javascript function `addText` so that it replaces `«` with `<` and `»` with `>`; and then you can use « and » when entering HTML within your Quest code. (This is my preferred method; but is only really useful if your keyboard is set up toi easily type «)

You will get an error on exiting code view if your code contains a string which contains the character < (possibly also >, but that seems to be okay sometimes).

4 options to work around this (use whichever you understand):

  1. Miss out the < and > when you edit in code view, and then add them in the GUI editor
  2. Use numeric values (so your code looks like msg (Chr(60) + "img src=\"https://i.imgur.com/vmFz0gn.jpg\" /" + Chr(62)))
  3. Make a text processor command to turn {lt} and {gt} into the < and > characters
  4. override the javascript function addText so that it replaces « with < and » with >; and then you can use « and » when entering HTML within your Quest code. (This is my preferred method; but is only really useful if your keyboard is set up toi easily type «)
